ProteinName	Cell adhesion molecule DSCAML1 (Down syndrome cell adhesion molecule 2) (Down syndrome cell adhesion molecule-like protein 1)
GeneName	DSCAML1 DSCAM2 KIAA1132
Length	1843
Function	Cell adhesion molecule that plays a role in neuronal self-avoidance (PubMed:11453658). Promotes repulsion between specific neuronal processes of either the same cell or the same subtype of cells. Promotes both isoneuronal self-avoidance for creating an orderly neurite arborization in retinal rod bipolar cells and heteroneuronal self-avoidance to maintain mosaic spacing between AII amacrine cells (By similarity). Adhesion molecule that promotes lamina-specific synaptic connections in the retina: expressed in specific subsets of interneurons and retinal ganglion cells (RGCs) and promotes synaptic connectivity via homophilic interactions (By similarity).
Subcellular Location	Cell membrane; Synapse
